0.09.text: Hello and welcome to My Weekly Geekery, the show in which I talk about what has been going on

3.51.text: in my geeky world over the past seven days.

5.17.text:
Bit of a Doctor Who special this
week. I don't know why I said a bit of a

8.21.text: Doctor Who special, it is a complete Doctor Who special, because all I'm talking about is

11.94.text: because Doctor Who. So in Doctor Who news,

15.99.text:
the BBC has released several new videos and
things for the fiftieth anniversary

19.94.text:
this week, to increase the hysteria for us
Whovians. Children in Need showed a preview

24.93.text: of The Day of the Doctor, when 10 and 11 meet. BBC Breakfast went behind the scenes of

29.70.text: The Day of the Doctor, with Lizo Mzimba presenting.

31.46.text:
Strax has released a field
report about Queen Elizabeth.

35.16.text:
BBC Wales's An Evening with Steven
Moffat has been released on the BBC

40.33.text: A clip has been released from An Adventure in Space and Time,  which is on Thursday,

44.14.text:
tomorrow, in the UK, and David Tennant has
given an introduction to the fiftieth

49.06.text: anniversary special. I have put links to

51.39.text:
all of those things in the description below.
Matt Smith and David Tennant are also going to be

55.72.text:
on the Graham Norton Show on Friday in
the UK,

58.25.text:
so watch that if you have the opportunity
'cause it will be awesome.

61.36.text:
BBC America has been hosting a
Doctor Who week on YouTube which is nice of them.

66.97.text: videos about Doctor Who, which are on a playlist on the BBC America

70.64.text: YouTube channel which I shall link to below. BBC America is also hosting a

76.18.text: on Saturday so do go to the BBC America YouTube channel

79.35.text: for lots of Doctory goodness. And finally, in

82.67.text:
massive news, the prequel to The Day
of the Doctor,

86.38.text:
The Night of the Doctor, has been
released early. It was released early due to the

91.09.text:
Stupid leaks. I have put a link to it below. It is
about my favourite thing that Steven

95.27.text: Moffat has done in a long time

96.83.text:
and I want to continue talking
about it so I'm going to put a big

101.82.text:
SPOILERS. So if you don't want to
listen to this bit then this is where you

106.40.text: the video. It features Paul McGann.

110.40.text:
Also John Hurt, but 8! We see the
regeneration of Paul McGann into John

115.17.text: Hurt. We hear his final words, 'Physician, heal thyself.'

118.71.text: It makes Eight's audio companions canon.

122.33.text: It's really, really good. I'm so happy. I watched it in an office,

126.31.text:
and may have caused several people to
question my sanity.

130.21.text: I was a little excited. So, in conclusion,

133.54.text: three days to go, people, three days.

137.88.text: This has been My Weekly Geekery.
